p: The current investigation is an extension of the heat aging experiments performed by Molnes et al. [ 17, 18]. The potential of CNCs as an EOR agent was tested by performing a core flood experiment in low salinity water. The core flood was performed at 120 Â°C using a long core (approx. 60 cm) and low flow rate in order for the CNC solution to have a long residence time within the porous media. The goal was to reproduce the same viscosification effect that was revealed in the Molnes et al. [ 18] study, and to determine the amount of incremental oil produced after water flooding. Permeability measurements were also conducted during the core flood.
